meanings.definition: Fleeches (verb): to coax or persuade someone through flattery or deceit
meanings.sent1: She fleeches her way into getting what she wants.
meanings.sent2: He always fleeches his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The sly fox fleeches the rabbit into sharing its carrots.
meanings.sent4: Her smile fleeches the truth out of even the most guarded hearts.
meanings.sent5: The con artist fleeches unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk.

meanings.definition: Fleeches (noun): a person who uses flattery or deceit to manipulate others
meanings.sent1: Beware of the fleeches who try to take advantage of your kindness.
meanings.sent2: The fleeches in the office always seem to get their way.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fleeches at the party were quickly exposed by their own lies.
meanings.sent4: She saw through the mask of the charming fleeches and kept her guard up.
meanings.sent5: The world is full of fleeches who prey on the trusting nature of others.
